---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/AppKit/NSView/setBoundsOrigin(_:)
crawled: 2025-12-04T18:34:07Z
---

# setBoundsOrigin(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the origin of the view’s bounds rectangle to a specified point.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setBoundsOrigin(_ newOrigin: NSPoint)
```

## Parameters

- **newOrigin**: A point specifying the new bounds origin of the view.

## Discussion

In setting the new bounds origin, this method effectively shifts the view’s coordinate system so `newOrigin` lies at the origin of the view’s frame rectangle. It neither redisplays the view nor marks it as needing display. Set the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/needsDisplay] property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when you want the view to be redisplayed.

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/boundsDidChangeNotification] to the default notification center if the view is configured to do so.

After calling this method, `NSView` creates an internal transform (or appends these changes to an existing internal transform) to convert from frame coordinates to bounds coordinates in your view. As long as the width-to-height ratio of the two coordinate systems remains the same, your content appears normal. If the ratios differ, your content may appear skewed.

## Related Documentation

- **translateOrigin(to:)**: Translates the view’s coordinate system so that its origin moves to a new location.

## Modifying the Bounds Rectangle

- **bounds**: The view’s bounds rectangle, which expresses its location and size in its own coordinate system.
- **setBoundsSize(_:)**: Sets the size of the view’s bounds rectangle to specified dimensions, inversely scaling its coordinate system relative to its frame rectangle.
- **boundsRotation**: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s bounds rectangle relative to its frame rectangle.
- **boundsDidChangeNotification**: A notification that posts when the view’s bounds rectangle changes to a new value independently of the frame rectangle.
- **postsBoundsChangedNotifications**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view posts notifications when its bounds rectangle changes.
